meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the transfer of phosphate groups from ATP to proteins.
meanings.sent1: Phosphokinases help proteins get energy from ATP.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phosphokinases to understand how cells work.
meanings.sent3: The phosphokinases in the cell were having a party with the proteins.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of cellular reactions, phosphokinases are the choreographers.
meanings.sent5: Imagine phosphokinases as tiny messengers delivering energy packages to proteins.

meanings.definition: Proteins that regulate cellular processes by phosphorylating other proteins.
meanings.sent1: Cells rely on phosphokinases to control important activities.
meanings.sent2: Phosphokinases play a crucial role in maintaining cell functions.
meanings.sent3: The phosphokinases were like traffic police directing the proteins in the cell.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra of cellular functions, phosphokinases are the conductors.
meanings.sent5: Visualize phosphokinases as the managers overseeing protein interactions in cells.

meanings.definition: Molecules involved in cell signaling pathways.
meanings.sent1: Phosphokinases act as messengers in cell communication.
meanings.sent2: Cell signaling relies on the precise actions of phosphokinases.
meanings.sent3: The phosphokinases were like secret agents passing messages between cells.
meanings.sent4: In the network of cellular conversations, phosphokinases are the translators.
meanings.sent5: Think of phosphokinases as the postal service delivering important signals within cells.
